title: Lusophone Foundation Facilities Insignia
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:paperstack]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:toggle-sidebar]]

[[module CSS]]
@media (min-width: 768px) {
    #main-content { max-width: min(900px, calc(100% - 4rem)); }
}
:root {
  --header-subtitle: "Secure Facilities";
  --sp_header-subtitle-scale: 2.125;
}
#header h1 a::before, #header h2 span::before {
    font-family: 'BauhausLTDemi', 'Nanum Gothic', 'Arial', sans-serif;
}

body {
    background-image: linear-gradient(
        to bottom,
        #FCFCFC, #FCFCFC 100%);
}

div#extra-div-1 {
    height: 140px;
    width: 100%;
    top: 28px;
    position: absolute;
    background: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/sigma-9-themes/SCP_F.png");
    background-size: contain;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-position: calc(50vw - 380px) 50%;
    z-index: -1;
}
@media (max-width: 767px) {
    div#extra-div-1 {
         opacity: 0.2;
         background-position: 50% 50%;
    }
}

.socontent.header h1 {
    font-size: 1.85rem;
    max-width: max-content;
    margin: 2.5rem auto 1rem;
}
.socontent.header h1 span {
    padding: 0 .25em;
    text-transform: uppercase;
}

.art-container {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    align-content: center;
    justify-content: space-around;
    align-self: flex-end
    gap: 1rem 1rem;
}
.art-container .art {
    flex: 0 1 250px;
    text-align: center;
    padding-bottom: 1rem;
}

.art-container .art .image-container {
    padding: 0;
    min-height: 100%;
    max-width: 100%;
}
[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]
@@@@
[[[jerden-insignia| Jerden's Art Page]]] / [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/instalacoes-seguras Secure Facilities of the Lusophone Foundation] » Lusophone Foundation Facilities Insignia

I made some Insignia for the Foundation Facilities of the Portuguese-speaking (Lusophone) Branch, based on **[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/instalacoes-seguras this translated list]**. Originally this was just for fun, since the countries they're in have some great national and regional flags, particularly Brazil where the majority of Sites are located. However, the Insignia I made ended up being used on the **[http://scp-pt-br.wikidot.com/instalacoes-seguras offical Lusophone Branch Facilities Page]**, so I guess I'm not the only one who liked them! I figured I'd make another art page to showcase them, it may be useful to people from PT-BR if they want to make more in the same style.

I based the outline on [[*user L200]]'s designs for Site and Area symbols, created for [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/instalacoes-seguras-mapa this map], to make them look more distinct from the [[[art:secure-facilities-locations| English-Language Facility insignia]]].

[[=]]
+ Site Insignia
[[/=]]

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT1.svg title="Site PT1" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT1, São Paulo, Brazil / Lisbon, Portugal 
Color scheme based on the [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/pt-hub| Lusophone Branch logo].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT4.svg title="Site PT4, Évora, Portugal" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT4, Évora, Portugal
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Portugal Flag of Portugal] – specifically the armillary sphere , since that’s a scientific tool.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT5.svg title="Site PT5, Mato Grosso, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT5, Mato Grosso, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mato_Grosso Mato Grosso].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT7.svg title="Site PT7, Federal District, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT7, Federal District, Brazil
Based off the flag of the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_District_(Brazil) Federal District], reshaped into a scroll since the Site is used as a library.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT10.svg title="Site PT10, Amazonas, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT10, Amazonas, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Amazonas_(Brazilian_state) Flag of Amazonas].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT13.svg title="Site PT13, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT13, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rio_Grande_do_Sul Rio Grande do Sul], with the addition of an [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Energy_icon.svg Electricity Arrow] since the Site focuses on electronics.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT17.svg title="Site PT17, Mato Grosso, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT17, Mato Grosso, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mato_Grosso Mato Grosso], with the addition of the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rod_of_Asclepius Rod of Asclepius] since it's a medical facility.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT19.svg title="Site PT19, Zambezia, Mozambique" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT19, Zambezia, Mozambique
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Mozambique Flag of Mozambique], which is officially one of my favorites due to the fact that they have a Kalashnikov rifle on the flag.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT20.svg title="Site PT20, Salvador, Bahia, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT20, Salvador, Bahia, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Bahia Flag of Bahia], with the addition of a [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mural_crown Mural Crown], since the Site is located within the City of Salvador.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT25.svg title="Site PT25, Santa Catarina, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT25, Santa Catarina, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Catarina_(state) Santa Catarina].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-PT33.svg title="Site PT33, Minas Gerais, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT33, Minas Gerais, Brazil
Based off the very simple flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minas_Gerais Minas Gerais], but I try to avoid writing in these so I replaced the "Libertas Quæ Sera Tamen" with arrows. I kind of like this design, even though it's abstract it seems very military to me.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[=]]
+ Area Insignia
[[/=]]

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Area-PT2.svg title="Area PT2, Maranhão, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Area PT2, Maranhão, Brazil
Based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Maranh%C3%A3o Flag of Maranhao], bars of Red-Black-White seems fitting for a maximum security area.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Area-PT9.svg title="Area PT9, Macau, China" width="250px"]]
++ Area PT9, Macau, China
Based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Macau Flag of Macau], not much to say other than the fact that Macau has a very distinctive flag.
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

[[=]]
+ Bonus Sites!
[[/=]]

Non-canon, I made these purely for fun. I may repurpose these designs in future if they fit for an actual Site (or Area) on the Lusaphone branch. I do try to add extra detail once I know what the Site does though. If anyone likes a design and wants to use it, feel free to change the number, I picked these basically at random.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT2.svg title="Site PT2, Portugal" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT2, Portugal
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Portugal Flag of Portugal], specifically the blue and white Quinas.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT3.svg title="Site PT3, Portugal" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT3, Portugal
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Portugal Flag of Portugal], specifically the red and gold castle bordure.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT6.svg title="Site PT6, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT6, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Brazil Flag of Brazil].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT8.svg title="Site PT8, Piauí, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT8, Piauí, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Piau%C3%AD Flag of Piauí].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT9.svg title="Site PT9, Tocantins, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT9, Tocantins, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tocantins Tocantins].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT11.svg title="Site PT11, Roraima, Portugal" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT11, Roraima, Portugal
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roraima Roraima].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT12.svg title="Site PT12, Pará, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT12, Pará, Brazil
Based off the Flag of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Par%C3%A1 Pará].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT14.svg title="Site PT14, Pernambuco, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT14, Pernambuco, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Pernambuco Flag of Pernambuco].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT15.svg title="Site PT15, Paraná , Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT15, Paraná, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Paran%C3%A1_(state) Flag of Paraná ].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT16.svg title="Site PT16, Espírito Santo, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT16, Espírito Santo, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo Flag of Espírito Santo].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT18.svg title="Site PT18, Rondônia, Brazil" width="250px"]]
++ Site PT18, Rondônia, Brazil
Based off the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Rond%C3%B4nia Flag of Rondônia ].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT21.svg title="Site PT21, Amapá, Brazil" width="250px"]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT22.svg title="Site PT22, Goiás, Brazil" width="250px"]]

[[div class="art"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Ainstalacoes-seguras/Site-PT24.svg title="Site PT24, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil" width="250px"]]
